psa_to_psw_hours.description: Personal Support Algorithm score → PSW hours/week

source.primary: Ontario Home Care PSA Implementation Guidelines
source.secondary: Clinical judgment based on typical utilization patterns
source.notes: Ranges are starting points; actual allocation depends on individual assessment

1.label: No PSW needed
1.rationale: SRI indicates self-reliance in all ADL and cognition areas

2.label: Minimal support
2.rationale: Light assistance needed; typically supervision or setup help only

3.label: Moderate support
3.rationale: ADL assistance required but not daily; approximately 1 hour/day average

4.label: Moderate-high support
4.rationale: Daily ADL support needed; approximately 2 hours/day

5.label: High support
5.rationale: Extensive daily support; approximately 3 hours/day, may require split visits

6.label: Very high support
6.rationale: Approaching 24-hour care threshold; 5 hours/day baseline. Consider facility referral assessment.

ADL_IMPROVEMENT_CAP.reason: ADL CAP triggered for improvement - increased PSW for restorative focus

CAREGIVER_RELIEF_AXIS.reason: Caregiver relief scenario selected - additional PSW for respite

COGNITIVE_SUPERVISION.reason: Cognitive impairment requires additional supervision time

rehab_to_therapy_visits.description: Rehabilitation Algorithm score → PT/OT combined visits/week

source.primary: InterRAI CA Rehabilitation Algorithm (Hirdes et al., 2008)
source.notes: Score 3+ strongly predicts benefit from community-based therapy

1.label: No therapy indicated
1.rationale: Self-reliant or palliative focus; no rehabilitation potential indicators

2.label: Maintenance therapy
2.rationale: Preserve current function; prevent decline. Weekly monitoring visit.

3.label: Moderate rehabilitation
3.rationale: Active improvement potential identified; standard community rehab protocol

4.label: Intensive rehabilitation
4.rationale: High improvement potential; may require coordinated PT+OT intervention

5.label: Very intensive rehabilitation
5.rationale: Maximum community-based intensity; consider inpatient rehab referral if available

pt_ot_split_rules.rationale: Mobility issues prioritize PT for gait/balance training
Environment issues prioritize OT for home safety assessment
ADL deficits benefit equally from PT (transfers) and OT (self-care)
Default even split between PT and OT

RECOVERY_REHAB_AXIS.reason: Recovery/rehab scenario selected - front-loaded therapy intensity

POST_ACUTE_EPISODE.reason: Post-acute episode type - enhanced early rehabilitation

source.primary: CHESS Scale Validation Studies (Hirdes et al., 2003)
source.notes: CHESS 4+ strongly predicts hospitalization within 90 days

0.label: Stable - PRN only
0.rationale: No health instability indicators; nursing as needed basis

1.label: Low instability
1.rationale: Minor health fluctuation; monitoring visit every 2 weeks

2.label: Moderate instability
2.rationale: Weekly monitoring recommended; watch for deterioration signs

3.label: High instability
3.rationale: Twice weekly visits; active symptom management needed

4.label: Very high instability
4.rationale: Every other day visits; high hospitalization risk - close monitoring

5.label: Critical - daily nursing
5.rationale: Daily visits required; consider palliative care or facility referral

SAFETY_STABILITY_AXIS.reason: Safety/stability scenario selected - enhanced nursing monitoring

PAIN_CAP_TRIGGERED.reason: Pain CAP triggered - additional nursing for pain management

dms_to_mental_health.description: Distressed Mood Scale score → Mental Health service recommendations

source.notes: DMS 3+ indicates clinically significant distress warranting intervention

1.label: Minimal distress
1.rationale: Occasional mild symptoms; monitor but no intervention needed

2.label: Mild distress
2.rationale: Some mood symptoms; supportive care during existing visits

3.label: Moderate distress
3.rationale: Consider SW or MH referral; biweekly check-in

5.label: High distress
5.rationale: Mental health consultation needed; potential MH specialist referral

dms_to_mental_health.escalation_note: DMS >= 4 should trigger mental health service consultation
